metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9845 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ReadDIBImage function in coders/dib.c in ImageMagick allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a corrupted dib file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5').
